old: エリオットは一見頼りないけど、腕は立つ
column2: Elliot is seemingly unreliable, but he is skilled.
speaker: Gillian

old: レスタニア者は一筋縄ではいかないね
column2: Lestania citizens are not easy to deal with.
speaker: Gillian

old: リズはああ見えて、かなりしっかりした子だね
column2: Lise, believe it or not, is a pretty reliable girl.
speaker: Gillian

old: 人は見かけによらない――そんな言葉を思い出したよ
column2: Appearances are deceiving--I remember that saying.
speaker: Gillian

old: ガルドリンは――見たとおりの人物のようだ
column2: Gurdolin--seems to be exactly what he looks like.
speaker: Gillian

old:
言葉の荒さも人の良さを隠すためのもの
まるでアッカーシェランの男のようにわかりやすい
column2: The harshness of words is also a means to conceal one's goodness, just like a man from Acre Selund, it is easy to understand.
speaker: Gillian

old:
隊長――あなたは不思議な人だな
あなたならなんとかしてくれる
――そう思わせてくれるよ
column2: Captain ―― you are an intriguing person I believe you can do something ―― You make me think that way.
speaker: Gillian

old:
そういう人のことを、このアッカーシェランでは
竜に愛されてる"と言うのさ"
column2: We in Acre Selund call such a person "loved by the dragon."
speaker: Gillian

old:
レスタニアも同じだろうけど
このアッカーシェランにも長い歴史があってね――
column2: Lestania is probably the same but Acre Selund also has a long history—
speaker: Gillian

old:
たいていは家と家、人と魔物の対立の歴史なんだ
竜との対立なんて初めてのことさ
column2: Usually, it is a history of conflict between houses and houses, and people and monsters. It's the first time there's been a conflict with dragons.
speaker: Gillian

old:
わたし、悪しき竜が現れるまでは野や山を見ても
何も思わなかったんだ
column2: Until the evil dragon appeared, I didn't think anything of the fields and mountains.
speaker: Gillian

old:
だけどね
自由に歩き回れるわけじゃなくなってからは
愛おしくてたまらない――勝手だよね
column2:
But you know, ever since I can no longer freely wander around,
I cherish it so much――it's selfish, isn't it?
speaker: Gillian

old: レスタニアには覚者が大勢いるんだろう？
column2: Are there a lot of Arisen in Lestania?
speaker: Gillian

old:
みんな強いのか？　一流の戦士なのか？
白翼覚者隊という生え抜きの部隊もあるんだよね
column2:
Are they all strong?　Are they first-class warriors?
There's also a freshly minted unit called the White Wing Arisen Corps.
speaker: Gillian

old: ――戦いが、いっぱいあるんだな
column2: -- I'm sure there's a lot of fighting going on.
speaker: Gillian

old: 白竜は長く病んでいると聞いている
column2: I have heard that The White Dragon has been ill for a long time.
speaker: Gillian

old:
早く良くなるといいな
竜はいつでも心身ともに健やかでいてくれないと
世が闇に覆われてしまうようだ
column2:
I hope you get better soon.
The world seems to be covered in darkness if the dragon is not always healthy both mentally, and physically.
speaker: Gillian

old: えーと、なに？
column2: Um, what?
speaker: Gillian

old:
こっちにいる間はわたしと一緒に
行動してもらうからね
column2: You'll be working with me while you're here.
speaker: Gillian

old:
将軍がいれば全体の士気もあがる
そういう人だよ、メイロワ将軍は
column2: Having a general boosts overall morale. That's the kind of person General Meirova is.
speaker: Gillian

old:
ネド王子とは、将軍に連れられて
挨拶に行って――それだけ
column2: Prince Nedo and I were taken by the General to greet him--that's it.
speaker: Gillian

old:
それでも、王子のためなら
戦えるし、王子を思えば希望を抱ける
column2: Still, if it's for the prince, I can fight, and if I think of the prince, I can hold onto hope.
speaker: Gillian

old:
――みんな同じさ
王家は、そういう一族なんだ
column2: -- all the same. The Royals are that kind of family.
speaker: Gillian

old:
今はネド王子が最優先
それ以外は考えたくないの
column2: Right now, Prince Nedo is the top priority. I don't want to think about anything else.
speaker: Gillian

old:
王子は状況に屈することなく
積極的に動いているみたいだね
column2: The prince seems to be actively moving forward without succumbing to the circumstances.
speaker: Gillian

old:
頼もしいと言えば頼もしいけど
本音を言うと――いや、やめておくよ
column2:
I'd say you're reliable, but...
To tell you the truth--no, I shouldn't.
speaker: Gillian

old:
ネド王子と一緒の時間を作ってよ
良き助言者になってほしい
column2:
Make time to be with Prince Nedo.
Be a good advisor.
speaker: Gillian

old:
オークどもの動きが活発だ
ふん、悪しき竜"の言いなりのくせに"
column2: The Orcs are quite active, huh? Hmph, even though they're under the control of the "Evil Dragon".
speaker: Gillian

old:
アッカーシェラン全土のオークが
動き始めたら、こっちも戦力を
分散する必要があるから――マズいね
column2: If all the orcs in Acre Selund start moving, we'll need to disperse our forces as well - that's not good.
speaker: Gillian

old: 悪しき竜"が現れたってね
今度来たら、逃がさないよ"
column2:
I heard an "evil dragon" showed up.
If he comes again, I won't let him get away.
speaker: Gillian

old:
イェルハルドの近くで戦うのは
とても勉強になるよ
column2: Fighting near Gerhard is very educational.
speaker: Gillian

old:
イェルハルドの近くで戦うのは
とても勉強になるよ
column2: Fighting near Gerhard is very educational.
speaker: Gillian

old:
戦いが終わったらさ――
城で会おうね
column2:
When the battle is over--
I'll see you at the castle.
speaker: Gillian

old:
はあ――いいね、やっぱり
この城は、落ち着くよ
column2:
Ha--good, I knew it.
This castle is so relaxing!
speaker: Gillian

old: ここに来て解放軍を増強できそうなんだ
column2: It seems like we can strengthen the Liberation Army by coming here.
speaker: Gillian

old:
人数が増えると作戦の選択肢も増えるし
あなたたちの負担も減るからね
column2:
The more people we have, the more operational options we have, and
the less work you guys have to do.
speaker: Gillian

old:
わたしたちはとにかく城内を駆け回って
混乱を誘いつつ敵の部隊を削る――いい？
column2: We will run around inside the castle, causing confusion and chipping away at the enemy's forces—sound good?
speaker: Gillian

old: ここにいてもいいの？
column2: Is it okay if I stay here?
speaker: Gillian

old: 借りを返すときが来たようだね
column2: It seems that the time has come to repay the debt.
speaker: Gillian

old: そっちも、こっちも、とりあえず一段落だね
column2: Both there and here, we have made some progress for now.
speaker: Gillian

old:
王子はアッカーシェランのただひとりの
覚者なんだ
column2: The Prince is the only Arisen of Acre Selund
speaker: Gillian

old:
王子の気持ち、わたしたちの気持ちが
どうあっても、選択肢はないよね
column2: The prince's feelings, our feelings, no matter what, there is no option.
speaker: Gillian

old:
焦っても仕方がないよね
――そう自分に言い聞かせてるよ
column2:
There's no point in rushing
-- that's what I keep telling myself.
speaker: Gillian

old:
ふと気づくと、あなたたちに頼っている
自分に気づいて、あれ？って思うんだよね
column2: When you suddenly realize, you depend on yourself and think, huh? When I suddenly realize it, I find myself relying on you guys. I become aware of myself and think, "Huh?"
speaker: Gillian

old: 王子も――そんな風に考えたのかな
column2: Did the prince also think that way?
speaker: Gillian

old:
悪しき竜との決戦がすぐそこにあるのに
気になることが多すぎるの
column2: The battle against the Evil Dragon is right around the corner, but there are too many things that I'm worried about.
speaker: Gillian

old:
死ぬかもしれないんだから、スッキリして
おきたいけど――贅沢なのかな
column2: Since I might die, I want to feel refreshed, but is that being extravagant?
speaker: Gillian

old: いよいよ決戦――
column2: Finally, the decisive battle—.
speaker: Gillian

old:
静かに、ギュッと――
覚悟を固めているのさ
column2: Quietly, firmly—I'm steeling my resolve.
speaker: Gillian

old:
こっちの状況が落ち着いたら
かならず訪ねていくから――
column2: Once this situation here settles down, I will definitely come to visit.
speaker: Gillian

old: 案内してくれる？
column2: Can you show me around?
speaker: Gillian
